basicInfo.notes: Founded as 1&1 EDV-Marketing GmbH in 1988 by Ralph Dommermuth. Merged with ProfitBricks in 2018, rebranded to 1&1 IONOS. Became IONOS in Jan 2020. IPO on Feb 8, 2023 (included in SDAX Sept 2023). Europe's largest hosting provider with 6.5M+ customers in 18 markets. Dual HQ: Montabaur, Germany and Philadelphia, PA. 4,000+ employees worldwide. Over 90,000 servers in 10+ data centers.

pricing.moneyBackExclusions: Setup fees non-refundable; Additional domains non-refundable; Items paid in advance non-refundable; Package switchers not eligible; TOS violators not eligible

policiesOverages.bandwidthOveragePolicy: Unlimited bandwidth; no throttling or overage charges
policiesOverages.storageOveragePolicy: Must upgrade plan; file limits apply per contract
policiesOverages.accountSuspensionPolicy: TOS violations lead to suspension; unpaid balances referred to collection (no credit impact)
policiesOverages.resourceAbuseDefinition: Exceeding file limits; hosting prohibited content; resource usage affecting other users
policiesOverages.hiddenFeesNotes: PHP Extended Support costs extra for older PHP versions; 2026 price adjustment announced; renewal prices significantly higher than promo; cPanel not available (proprietary panel only); some users report difficult cancellation process

business.affiliateCommissionAmount: Commission varies by product; 8 international markets available; free to join

editorial.knownIssues: 2026 price adjustment announced (increases); No cPanel (proprietary panel only); PHP CLI version differs from hosting environment via SSH; Difficult cancellation process reported; Auto-renewal complaints; Control panel feels outdated; No Node.js/Python on shared hosting; Limited developer flexibility compared to cPanel hosts
editorial.bestFor: European businesses (largest EU host); Users wanting 24/7 phone support; Short 12-month contracts (vs 36-48 month competitors); Free Wildcard SSL included; VPS users ($2/mo entry); Users preferring established BBB A+ company; Geo-redundant infrastructure needs
editorial.avoidIf: Need cPanel; Developers needing Node.js/Python; Adult or gambling content; Prefer transparent renewal pricing; Dislike proprietary control panels; Need caching/LiteSpeed performance
editorial.competitorComparisonNotes: Cheapest VPS ($2/mo) vs Hostinger/Namecheap; 99.99% uptime (higher than 99.9% competitors); Phone support 24/7 (unlike Namecheap/Hostinger); DigiCert Wildcard SSL (better than Let's Encrypt); ISO 27001 certified; BBB A+ (unlike Namecheap D-); No LiteSpeed (Hostinger has it); Proprietary panel vs cPanel (Namecheap); Short 12-mo contracts vs 48-mo competitors

comparisonData.uniqueSellingPoint: Europe's largest host with 99.99% uptime, free Wildcard SSL, and $2/mo VPS entry
comparisonData.idealCustomerProfile: European business needing 24/7 phone support, compliance certifications, and geo-redundancy

faqContent.faqIsThisHostGood: IONOS is excellent for European businesses needing 24/7 phone support and compliance certifications, but has limited developer features.
faqContent.faqWhoOwnsThisHost: IONOS is owned by United Internet AG, a publicly traded German company. IONOS itself went public in February 2023.
faqContent.faqHowMuchDoesItCost: IONOS shared hosting starts at $1/month (promo) and renews at $12/month. First year costs approximately $12.
faqContent.faqIsItBeginnerFriendly: Moderately. IONOS has 24/7 phone support but uses a proprietary control panel that may feel dated compared to cPanel.
faqContent.faqDoesItIncludeEmail: Yes, IONOS includes 1 email account with 2GB storage on the basic plan.
faqContent.faqCanIHostWordPress: Yes, IONOS offers WordPress hosting with auto-install, auto-updates, and WooCommerce optimization.
faqContent.faqWhatsTheUptime: IONOS guarantees 99.99% uptime, one of the highest in the industry, with SLA credits.
faqContent.faqCanICancelAnytime: Yes, with a 30-day money-back guarantee. Some users report difficult cancellation processes.
